name: wrangling
content:
wrangling noun
(ARGUING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] arguments, especially ones that continue for a long time: The new overtime rule generated months of political wrangling. Experts expect considerable legal wrangling before the Supreme Court decides. The legal wranglings dragged on for months.
More examplesFewer examplesBehind the legislation lie months of wrangling.The political wrangling continues in Washington.After months of bureaucratic wrangling, she adopted a child.

wrangling noun
(CONTROLLING ANIMALS)
[ U ] the activity of taking care of, controlling, or moving animals, especially large animals such as cows or horses: A display of wild horse wrangling attracted thousands of visitors in northeastern Germany. The actor had to learn cattle wrangling skills for his new movie.
More examplesFewer examplesRodeo culture developed from Mexican cattle wrangling and bull riding.The story about a talking mouse is a natural vehicle for this mix of hi-tech special effects and animal wrangling.
